{"step_by_step_thinking": "Congenital ossicular dysfunction refers to a condition where the ossicles, or small bones in the middle ear, do not function properly. This can lead to hearing loss. The most common type of this condition is not an isolated stapes defect, nor a stapes defect with fixation of footplate and lenticular process involvement. The most common type is actually a defective lenticular process of incus.", "answer_choice": "C"}
